title: Informatica cloud (IICS) taskflow does not load only in Firefox
content:
I am using Informatica cloud(IICS) through Firefox and use MacOS. It worked absolutely fine when I was using it before 7-8 months earlier. Even the "Firefox 99.0.dmg" absolutely works fine but it feels laggy because it is older (this is not an issue). But when I download the latest Firefox from the Firefox site, it just keeps on loading the taskflow infinitely and taskflow does not get loaded.

Steps to replicate: 1. Create a account using https://dm-us.informaticacloud.com/identity-service/home 2. Create a new taskflow (steps) 3. It will keeps on loading.

However, when I use edge, chrome, brave, it works fine. Not sure what is blocking the taskflow to load. It hits the URL: https://usw5.dm-us.informaticacloud.com/diUI/products/integrationDesign/main/taskflow/__new_ae_florence_docentry_1
creator: firefox_user008

title: Address bar is justified right for no reason. This will probably be the last straw for me when it comes this crappy Firefox browser.
content:
Why... why on earth would the people who built Firefox include a mechanism (I will not call it a feature) that causes the address bar to justify to the right. It's confusing and annoying and remarkably challenging to fix from what I can tell. Several threads on various sites never did fix this issue.

So, come on Firefox brains - if you guys and gals are so smart and have such a good thing here, why can't you figure out how to get the text justified back to the left.

This just proves Firefox is the Kia of website browsers. More private? Maybe, but because it's more antiquated and amateurishly designed.

Solutions? I won't hold my breath. I'm on Windows 10 Home.

title: Weird Firefox behaviour
content:
Trivial example of "weird" behaviour:

I have an Adobe Reader window open and a Google Chrome window open on my screen. I click on Firefox to open another window and both the Adobe and the Chrome windows are removed from my screen. No tiling. Just moved away. I can get the Adobe and/or Chrome window back, but then Firefox "disappears." This makes Firefox unusable for me. I have NOT changed any of my Firefox settings in probably years. Help please.
